SEARCH

Klasse Operation

java.lang.Object
Operation
public class Operation extends Object
A few arithmetic operations that could be needed are outsourced here.

  • Methodendetails

    • getVariance

      public static BigInteger getVariance(String countSolver, List<int[]> cnf, int numberOfVariables) throws Exception
      runs the selected counting solver and returns the variance if the given cnf
      Parameter:
      countSolver - which counting solver should be used
      cnf - the cnf to calculate the variance for
      numberOfVariables - how many variables are in the cnf
      Gibt zurück:
      the variance of the given cnf
      Löst aus:
      Exception - if the counting solver is unknown

    • getVariance_c2d

      public static BigInteger getVariance_c2d(List<int[]> cnf, int numberOfVariables) throws Exception
      Calculates the variance of a given CNF (Conjunctive Normal Form) problem. This method first generates the CNF data from the provided list of clauses and the number of variables. Each clause is represented as an array of integers in the 'cnf' parameter. The CNF data is then written to a file ending with '.cnf'. Afterward, it runs the 'c2d' console application to count the number of models (satisfying assignments) for the CNF problem. The count is parsed from the 'c2d' output and returned.
      Parameter:
      cnf - A list of clauses, each represented as an array of integers, forming the CNF problem.
      numberOfVariables - The number of variables in the CNF problem.
      Gibt zurück:
      A BigInteger representing the count of satisfying assignments (models) of the CNF problem.
      Löst aus:
      Exception - If the method is unable to read the counting models from the 'c2d' output.

    • getVariance_sharpSAT

      public static BigInteger getVariance_sharpSAT(List<int[]> cnf, int numberOfVariables) throws Exception
      Calculates the variance of a given CNF (Conjunctive Normal Form) problem. This method first generates the CNF data from the provided list of clauses and the number of variables. Each clause is represented as an array of integers in the 'cnf' parameter. The CNF data is then written to a file ending with '.cnf'. Afterward, it runs the 'sharpSAT' console application to count the number of models (satisfying assignments) for the CNF problem. The count is parsed from the 'sharpSAT' output and returned.
      Parameter:
      cnf - A list of clauses, each represented as an array of integers, forming the CNF problem.
      numberOfVariables - The number of variables in the CNF problem.
      Gibt zurück:
      A BigInteger representing the count of satisfying assignments (models) of the CNF problem.
      Löst aus:
      Exception - If the method is unable to read the counting models from the 'sharpSAT' output.

    • pointsToBigInt

      public static String pointsToBigInt(BigInteger number)
      Formats a BigInteger number into a string with points (periods) for improved readability. This method converts the BigInteger number into a string and then inserts points after every third digit from the right. The formatted string makes it easier to read large numbers by visually breaking them into groups of three digits.
      Parameter:
      number - The BigInteger number to be formatted.
      Gibt zurück:
      A string representation of the BigInteger, formatted with points for better readability. For example, a BigInteger with the value 1234567 will be formatted as "1.234.567".

    • calculatePercentage

      public static BigInteger calculatePercentage(BigInteger number, double percentage)
      Computes the percentage of a BigInteger value. This function takes a BigInteger 'number' and a double 'percentage', then calculates the specified percentage of the BigInteger. The calculation is performed with BigDecimal precision to handle the large scale of BigInteger and the floating-point nature of the percentage. The final result is rounded to the nearest integer value using the HALF_UP rounding mode, ensuring accuracy and precision in the calculation, especially in cases of large numbers or small percentage values.
      Parameter:
      number - The BigInteger value for which the percentage is to be calculated.
      percentage - A double representing the percentage to calculate. For instance, a value of 20.5 would calculate 20.5% of the BigInteger 'number'.
      Gibt zurück:
      A BigInteger representing the calculated percentage of the original number. The result is rounded to the nearest integer using the HALF_UP rounding mode.

    • isIn

      public static boolean isIn(int[] list, int var)
      Checks if a given integer is present in an array of integers. This method iterates through each element of the provided integer array (list) and compares it with the specified integer (var). If a match is found, the method returns true, indicating that the integer is present in the array. If no match is found by the end of the array, the method returns false.
      Parameter:
      list - An array of integers in which to search for the specified integer.
      var - The integer to be searched for within the array.
      Gibt zurück:
      A boolean value; true if 'var' is found in 'list', false otherwise.

    • isIn

      public static boolean isIn(List<int[]> list, int[] member)
      Checks if a given integer is present in a list of integer arrays. This method iterates through each element of the provided list of integer arrays (list) and compares it with the specified integer array (member). If a match is found, the method returns true, indicating that the integer array is present in the list. If no match is found by the end of the list, the method returns false.
      Parameter:
      list - A list of integer arrays in which to search for the specified integer array.
      member - The integer array to be searched for within the list.
      Gibt zurück:
      A boolean value; true if 'member' is found in 'list', false otherwise.
